body_html:
I'm worried this is simply enabling error prone user code. If you're going to go through the trouble of sending your own hidden state to RNN instead of leaving it out and letting RNN module handle hidden state initialization to Zero, you should be expected to size it correctly. Maybe the better fix is to throw an error on CPU side.

User reporting issue did not provide a convincing reason IMO as to why this is necessary.
